text: Induction of immediate early response genes by macrophage colony - stimulating factor in normal human monocytes .

A group of coordinately induced protooncogenes , cytoskeletal , and extracellular matrix genes have been termed immediate early response genes , and their induction has been associated with growth factor - stimulated cell proliferation .

We have investigated the induction of these genes by <extra_id_0> macrophage-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) in human monocytes that do not proliferate in response to <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> but require the factor for optimal cell differentiation .
Normal human monocytes were isolated , carefully washed , and incubated for 36 to 48 h in fetal bovine serum - containing medium .
At the end of this incubation the resting cells were stimulated with <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and RNA was isolated for analysis by Northern blotting .
RNA from control resting cells contained low to undetectable levels of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , fibronectin receptor , and actin mRNA .
Within 15 to 30 min of addition of <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , however , there was a dramatic coordinate induction of these genes .
The <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression was very transient and was not detectable by 60 min after <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> addition .

text: In contrast , the expression of actin and fibronectin receptor mRNA was more sustained , and the expression of these genes remained elevated at 24 to 48 h after <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> addition .
We also observed the induction of the myelomonocytic specific tyrosine kinase <extra_id_0> hck <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene simultaneously with the other immediate early response genes .

The protein synthesis inhibitor cycloheximide did not block the induction of any of these genes , and in fact , super-induced the expression of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> hck <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Nuclear run on transcription of the <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> hck <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and actin genes .

text: Therefore , in normal human monocytes <extra_id_0> M-CSF <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces immediate early response genes without inducing cell proliferation .
These genes may then play a role in altering the physiologic status of the cells in response to CSF .
